title: Create Component Generator Schema
description: Creates a SCAM (Single Component Angular Module) library

groupingFolder.description: The grouping folder that the component will be created in

name.description: The name of the component. This is optional if you only have one of the component types, e.g. shell or feature
name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component?

type.description: The type of component to create

x-prompt.message: Which type of component would you like to create?

items.label: shell - for the parent smart component, i.e. container for the page. It also includes routing for the domain and is the export point for the domain. The shell module will be lazy loaded in other domains and applications

unitTestType.description: The type of unit test file to create

x-prompt.message: What type of test file do you want to create?

items.label: Do not create "spec.ts" test files for the new component
create a "spec.ts" test file for the new component that uses TestbBed
create a "spec.ts" test file for the new component that does not use TestbBed

viewEncapsulation.description: The view encapsulation strategy to use in the new component.

x-prompt.message: Which type of view encapsulation would you like to use?

items.label: Emulate Native scoping of styles by adding an attribute containing surrogate id to the Host Element and pre-processing the style rules provided via styles or styleUrls, and adding the new Host Element attribute to all selectors. This is the default option
Don't provide any template or style encapsulation
Use Shadow DOM to encapsulate styles

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

strict.description: Makes the domain libraries have stricter type checking and build optimization options

enableIvy.description: Makes the domain libraries have ivy enabled in tsconfig.lib.prod.json. Should not be used with publishable libraries.

prefix.description: Prefix to use for the selector. If nothing is passed, the domain grouping folder + type + component name will be used

addJestJunitReporter.description: Whether to add the jest junit reporter to the jest config
